paragraphs.body: A vast range of fauna inhabit the ${link_0}, ranging over virtually every landscape as well as the oceans and skies. Most of the animals presented are hybirds of two real world animals; sometimes this hybridization is explicit, at other times more subtle. There are certain exceptions though, such as ${link_1}'s pet bear, ${link_2}, the ${link_3}'s cat, ${link_4}, or the ${link_5}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: A vast range of fauna inhabit the World of Avatar, ranging over virtually every landscape as well as the oceans and skies. Most of the animals presented are hybirds of two real world animals; sometimes this hybridization is explicit, at other times more subtle. There are certain exceptions though, such as Kuei's pet bear, Bosco, the herbalist's cat, Miyuki, or the messenger hawk.

paragraphs.body: There are several distinct habitats in the Avatar World, suitable for different animals and ${link_0}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: There are several distinct habitats in the Avatar World, suitable for different animals and plants.

paragraphs.body: Due to the wet ${link_0} and abundant vegetation, the ${link_1} plays host to a large variety of fauna. Hundreds of living things are densely packed into the swamp; this includes ${link_2}, ${link_3}, ${link_4}, and ${link_5}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Due to the wet climate and abundant vegetation, the Foggy Swamp plays host to a large variety of fauna. Hundreds of living things are densely packed into the swamp; this includes glowflies, elbow leeches, screeching birds, and catgators.

paragraphs.body: The ${link_0} has various species due to an arid climate. This unique area is home to certain creatures, such as the ${link_1}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: The Great Divide has various species due to an arid climate. This unique area is home to certain creatures, such as the canyon crawlers.

paragraphs.body: The low temperatures in both the ${link_0} and ${link_1} do not allow for much fauna to thrive. However, there are some animals that have adapted to the cold environment, such as ${link_2}, ${link_3}, ${link_4}, ${link_5}, and ${link_6}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: The low temperatures in both the Northern and Southern Water Tribes do not allow for much fauna to thrive. However, there are some animals that have adapted to the cold environment, such as otter penguins, tiger seals, polar dogs, polar bear dogs, and buffalo yaks.

paragraphs.body: The ${link_0} has the driest, hottest climate in the world. The desert's ecosystem primarily consists of a few scavenger species such as the ${link_1}, predatory insects known as ${link_2}, ${link_3}, which are used for ${link_4}, scorpions, and ${link_5}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: The Si Wong Desert has the driest, hottest climate in the world. The desert's ecosystem primarily consists of a few scavenger species such as the gilacorn, predatory insects known as buzzard wasps, giant rhinoceros beetles, which are used for transportation, scorpions, and jackalopes.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Small, brown, and furry rodent with a musical call.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Singing groundhog — Small, brown, and furry rodent with a musical call.

paragraphs.body: Skunk bear — Cross of a skunk and a bear.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Skunk bear — Cross of a skunk and a bear.

paragraphs.body: Sour beetle — Only creature in the Si Wong Desert the giant ${link_0} would not eat. According to legend, the headpieces worn by ${link_1} were crafted to mimic the appearance of a sour beetle, an intuitive trick that allowed the tribesmen to deceive gilacorns and avoid being attacked.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Sour beetle — Only creature in the Si Wong Desert the giant gilacorn would not eat. According to legend, the headpieces worn by beetle-headed merchants were crafted to mimic the appearance of a sour beetle, an intuitive trick that allowed the tribesmen to deceive gilacorns and avoid being attacked.

paragraphs.body: Spider — Eight-legged arachnid capable of quickly weaving a web.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Spider — Eight-legged arachnid capable of quickly weaving a web.

paragraphs.body: Spider snake — Ten-eyed chimerical creature known to inhabit the Earth Kingdom. In gambling, rolling two fives is known as "spider snake eyes".
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Spider snake — Ten-eyed chimerical creature known to inhabit the Earth Kingdom. In gambling, rolling two fives is known as "spider snake eyes".

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Small mammal indigenous to forests. It has membranes between its legs that enable it to glide.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Sugar glider — Small mammal indigenous to forests. It has membranes between its legs that enable it to glide.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Turkey and duck hybrid.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Turkey duck — Turkey and duck hybrid.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Green and brown frog with a trim of white fur.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Badgerfrog — Green and brown frog with a trim of white fur.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Mollusk found in the ${link_1}; outer shell blisters when its environment is ravaged by water pollution.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Clam — Mollusk found in the Jang Hui River; outer shell blisters when its environment is ravaged by water pollution.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — A cross between a dolphin and a flying fish; can be ridden for recreational purposes.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Flying dolphin fish — A cross between a dolphin and a flying fish; can be ridden for recreational purposes.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Green aquatic reptile characterized by its unusual call.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Iguana seal — Green aquatic reptile characterized by its unusual call.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Large aquatic mammal used to tug boats over the sea.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Sea lion — Large aquatic mammal used to tug boats over the sea.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Crab with a protective turtle shell.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Turtle crab — Crab with a protective turtle shell.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Duck with a protective green shell.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Turtle duck — Duck with a protective green shell.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Mutated fish spawned by the contamination of the ${link_1}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Two-headed fish — Mutated fish spawned by the contamination of the Jang Hui River.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Large, flying reptile with a long body; the original ${link_1}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Dragon — Large, flying reptile with a long body; the original firebenders.

paragraphs.body: Eagle hawk — Cross between an eagle and a hawk.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Eagle hawk — Cross between an eagle and a hawk.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — A large bat found in the Fire Nation; it is a cross between a bat and a butterfly or a moth.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Flutter bat — A large bat found in the Fire Nation; it is a cross between a bat and a butterfly or a moth.

paragraphs.body: Hawk — Non-hybridized hawk.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Hawk — Non-hybridized hawk.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Vulture and lion cross.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Lion vulture — Vulture and lion cross.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Non-hybridized bird of prey with dark red or brown feathers and a lighter underside. It is used to deliver messages.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Messenger hawk — Non-hybridized bird of prey with dark red or brown feathers and a lighter underside. It is used to deliver messages.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Avian animal that can be trained to intercept messenger hawks.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Raven eagle — Avian animal that can be trained to intercept messenger hawks.

paragraphs.body: Sea raven — Stylistically depicted in the emblem of the ${link_0}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Sea raven — Stylistically depicted in the emblem of the Southern Raiders.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Sea bird with a large yellow bill.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Toucan puffin — Sea bird with a large yellow bill.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Used in the ${link_1} to clean off ${link_2}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Aardvark sloth — Used in the Sun Warriors' ancient city to clean off slime.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Large bear with a hard, segmented shell.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Armadillo bear — Large bear with a hard, segmented shell.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — White arthropod with four legs.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Cavehopper — White arthropod with four legs.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Used for pulling carriages.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Dragon moose — Used for pulling carriages.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Elephant and rat cross.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Elephant rat — Elephant and rat cross.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Domesticated omnivorous mammal with black spots.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Hippo cow — Domesticated omnivorous mammal with black spots.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Koala and sheep hybrid.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Koala sheep — Koala and sheep hybrid.

paragraphs.body: Komodo chicken — A cross between a komodo dragon and a chicken; can be consumed as food.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Komodo chicken — A cross between a komodo dragon and a chicken; can be consumed as food.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Ferocious creature characterized by its versatility and ability to function over many different types of terrain; it is therefore useful as a cavalry mount, but is also used to make ${link_1}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Komodo rhino — Ferocious creature characterized by its versatility and ability to function over many different types of terrain; it is therefore useful as a cavalry mount, but is also used to make komodo sausages.

paragraphs.body: Meer penguin — A cross between a meerkat and a penguin.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Meer penguin — A cross between a meerkat and a penguin.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Mongoose and basilisk lizard cross used for transportation.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Mongoose lizard — Mongoose and basilisk lizard cross used for transportation.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — A cross between a puma and a goat.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Puma goat — A cross between a puma and a goat.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — A small forest dwelling animal, it is a cross between a squirrel and a toad.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Squirrel toad — A small forest dwelling animal, it is a cross between a squirrel and a toad.

paragraphs.body: Tigerdillo — A hybrid between a tiger and an armadillo; known for its roar and defensive nature.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Tigerdillo — A hybrid between a tiger and an armadillo; known for its roar and defensive nature.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Hybrid of a tiger and a monkey.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Tiger monkey — Hybrid of a tiger and a monkey.

paragraphs.body: Maggot slug — A cross between a maggot and a slug.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Maggot slug — A cross between a maggot and a slug.

paragraphs.body: Sea slug — Large slug sometimes cooked for food.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Sea slug — Large slug sometimes cooked for food.

paragraphs.body: Dragonfly hummingbird — a flying creature with the head, legs, and chest of a hummingbird, while sporting the wings, scales, and tail of a dragonfly. It can fly in any direction, which gave ${link_0} the idea to design a flying ${link_1} after its image.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Dragonfly hummingbird — a flying creature with the head, legs, and chest of a hummingbird, while sporting the wings, scales, and tail of a dragonfly. It can fly in any direction, which gave Asami Sato the idea to design a flying mecha suit after its image.

paragraphs.body: Fish — Aquatic fauna found in the ponds of ${link_0}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Fish — Aquatic fauna found in the ponds of Avatar Korra Park.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Lizard and crow cross that lives in urban areas.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Lizard crow — Lizard and crow cross that lives in urban areas.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Flying mammal found on ${link_1}; closely related to the ${link_2}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Ring-tailed winged lemur — Flying mammal found on Air Temple Island; closely related to the winged lemur.

paragraphs.body: Rooster pigeon — Sits on the telephone wires in ${link_0}, especially by the docks.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Rooster pigeon — Sits on the telephone wires in Republic City, especially by the docks.

paragraphs.body: Spider rat — Lives within the houses of Republic City and is considered to be an urban pest.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Spider rat — Lives within the houses of Republic City and is considered to be an urban pest.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Primate with brown fur.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Curly-tailed blue nose — Primate with brown fur.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Colorful, bunny-like spirits capable of flight.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Dragonfly bunny spirit — Colorful, bunny-like spirits capable of flight.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Supernatural entity that watches over the forested regions of the northwestern Earth Kingdom.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Forest spirit — Supernatural entity that watches over the forested regions of the northwestern Earth Kingdom.

paragraphs.body: Giant wolf — Creature identical to an actual wolf with the exception of its gargantuan size.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Giant wolf — Creature identical to an actual wolf with the exception of its gargantuan size.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Guardian spirit of a ${link_1} that normally assumes the form of a panda bear, but transforms into an aggressive monster with six limbs when enraged.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Hei Bai — Guardian spirit of a forest that normally assumes the form of a panda bear, but transforms into an aggressive monster with six limbs when enraged.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Foxes that assist the knowledge spirit, ${link_1}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Knowledge Seekers — Foxes that assist the knowledge spirit, Wan Shi Tong.

paragraphs.body: Koi fish — Physical manifestation of the spirits ${link_0} and ${link_1}, who correspond with the Moon and Ocean, respectively. Two fish are found in the Northern Water Tribe's ${link_2}, one of which is primarily white and the other black. They continuously swim in a circle, performing an eternal dance of push and pull.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Koi fish — Physical manifestation of the spirits Tui and La, who correspond with the Moon and Ocean, respectively. Two fish are found in the Northern Water Tribe's Spirit Oasis, one of which is primarily white and the other black. They continuously swim in a circle, performing an eternal dance of push and pull.

paragraphs.body: Meerkat prairie dog — A cross between a meerkat and a prairie dog.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Meerkat prairie dog — A cross between a meerkat and a prairie dog.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Moth and wasp cross; the ${link_1} has the ability to breathe these.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Moth wasp — Moth and wasp cross; the wolf spirit has the ability to breathe these.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Bioluminescent insect.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Spirit World firefly — Bioluminescent insect.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Spirit living near ${link_1}. It is extremely large and has the ability to breathe ${link_2}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Wolf spirit — Spirit living near Hira'a. It is extremely large and has the ability to breathe moth wasps.

paragraphs.body: Bunch hornet — A type of flying insect that disguises itself as fruit.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Bunch hornet — A type of flying insect that disguises itself as fruit.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Cross between a cat and a deer; it can be domesticated and is large enough to be ridden.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Cat deer — Cross between a cat and a deer; it can be domesticated and is large enough to be ridden.

paragraphs.body: Chicken lizard — Cross between a chicken and a lizard.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Chicken lizard — Cross between a chicken and a lizard.

paragraphs.body: Eel swan — An elegant animal from which many upper-class topiaries are based.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Eel swan — An elegant animal from which many upper-class topiaries are based.

paragraphs.body: Elephant — A large mammal known for its oversized ears.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Elephant — A large mammal known for its oversized ears.

paragraphs.body: Elephant rhino — A large animal that is a cross between an elephant and a rhinoceros.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Elephant rhino — A large animal that is a cross between an elephant and a rhinoceros.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — Symbol of the ${link_1}.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Flying boar — Symbol of the Beifong family.

paragraphs.body: Lion elephant — Cross between a lion and an elephant.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Lion elephant — Cross between a lion and an elephant.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} — An ancient species that can grow to immense sizes. Vegetation will occasionally sprout on its back, and cities are sometimes built on its shell.
section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Lion turtle — An ancient species that can grow to immense sizes. Vegetation will occasionally sprout on its back, and cities are sometimes built on its shell.

section: Fauna in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Meerpenguin — Cross between a meerkat and a penguin.

paragraphs.body: Monkey marmot — Cross between a monkey and a marmot, known for its persistence in resisting domesticity.

paragraphs.text: Monkey marmot — Cross between a monkey and a marmot, known for its persistence in resisting domesticity.

paragraphs.body: Opossum bat — Cross between an opossum and a bat, often used as an idiom ("playing opossum bat") to describe when someone is feigning defeat, death, illness, etc.

paragraphs.text: Opossum bat — Cross between an opossum and a bat, often used as an idiom ("playing opossum bat") to describe when someone is feigning defeat, death, illness, etc.

paragraphs.text: Pheasant squirrel — Cross between a common pheasant and a squirrel.
